content: Objects put into a collection are upcasted to the Object class. This means that you need to cast the object reference back when you get an element out of the collection. It also means that you need to know the type of the object when you take it out. If a collection contains different types of objects, we will have difficulty finding out the type of the objects obtained from a collection at run time. For example. let's use this collection with two objects in it:
